column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Mother Mary Anthony'''.<ref name=C>{{CG|C}}

column1: *'''Subject:''' [[Charles Williams]]. Tolkien writes that he has little personal knowledge of Williams's "''biographical or mental history''"
column2: and that he "''had no personal discussions with him about literature. His work gave me no pleasure'' [...] ''But I found him a pleasant companion socially''."

column1: *'''Publication:''' Extracts from the letter have appeared in [[Mythlore 45|''Mythlore'' 45]]
column2: <ref>[http://www.tolkienbooks.net/php/details.php?reference=65875 Mythlore 45. Spring 1986] at [http://www.tolkienbooks.net/ TolkienBooks.net] (accessed 18 November 2011)</ref> and in [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide|''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology'']] (p. 662).
